IAVGVideo Interface Reference

import "IAVGVideo.idl";

Detailed Description

Videorecorder-like interface to videos. Videos are always played back at the framerate of the player. If a different framerate given in the video file, it is ignored. A video starts in stopped mode and play() must be called to start playback.

All videos also have the attributes supported by IAVGNode.

Member Function Documentation

long IAVGVideo::getCurFrame (   ) 
 

Returns the current playback image.

long IAVGVideo::getNumFrames (   ) 
 

Returns number of images in the video.

void IAVGVideo::pause (   ) 
 

Stops playback but leaves the file open. If the file has not been opened, it is opened when pause is called.

void IAVGVideo::play (   ) 
 

Starts playback. If the video was stopped, starts on frame 0. If the video was paused, resumes at the next frame.

void IAVGVideo::seekToFrame (  in long  num  ) 
 

Moves the playback pointer to a new frame.

void IAVGVideo::stop (   ) 
 

Stops playback and closes the file.
